Here, E is referred to as the expectations operator and is used to indicate the
computation of a probability-weighted average. The symbol x, represents the first
observed value (observation) for random variable X, x, is the second observation, and so
on, through the nth observation. The concept of expected value may be demonstrated
using the a priori probabilities associated with a coin toss. On the flip of one coin, the
occurrence of the event “heads” may be used to assign the value of one to a random
variable. Alternatively, the event “tails” means the random variable equals zero.
